title: E field of distribution - E at L and 2L from bar

content.question: A thin bar of length <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math> is uniformly charged with a linear charge density of <math alttext="lambda" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>λ</mi></math>. Points <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> lie along the bar’s axis, as shown in the figure, at the indicated distances. What is the ratio <math alttext="the fraction with numerator E sub B, and denominator E sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>E</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><msub><mi>E</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></mfrac></math> of the electric field magnitudes at points <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> and <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>?

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
